title: Have you ever felt it was your loss when you broke up with your ex? - Quora

response.answer_text: HELL F**K NO! I was with my ex husband for 4 years before we got married, he was so sweet, treated me like a princess, anything I wanted, I got, no questions asked, material and all else. He used to take me on a different date night, every Friday and Saturday nights, surprising me with fancy dinners, weekends away, beautiful harbour cruises, bars and clubs, gifts, even just going to the movies or having a quiet one at home, playing cards or watching a movie with popcorn. He used to wake up early to go grab me a latte from my favourite cafe and bring it to my house before he went to work. Sounds perfect right? When something sounds like it’s too good to be true, it’s because it is! 4 years no red flags. The day we got married everything changed, he claims he “lost his job” because he went on his honeymoon (thinks he was talking to a 3 year old) started drug dealing. He didn’t put a gun to my head and I was the curious type but I can honest to god, say he is the reason I’ve been an addict for 16 years, he made it readily available at all times. He assault me physically (choking me once to an inch of my life or punching me like I was a man) verbally, mentally and worst of all sexually. He withheld money, I wasn’t allowed to buy anything, I remember I needed a new phone, he wouldn’t get it for me, so My dad got it for me. I wasn’t working at the time so obviously I didn’t have my own money. I gave him plenty of chances to change, told him maybe the apartment we were living in was cursed, let’s move to my parents house , we can save money and buy our own home, he also promised to stop dealing. I find out a month later while living at my parents, he was still renting the other apartment and had someone running “the business” for him. I kicked him out of my family house and never looked back … My loss? HELL NO.

Severally, In my early days I suffered the loss of relationship through harsh judging parents and a couple of fatalities, one Cancer and one Car accident not actually breakups as losses for the second two But having parents disagree because of Race (I’m part Japanese) or loosing a dear late teen girlfriend to Cancer really hits hard. Finding out that another Dear young friend was passenger in a fatal car accident a couple of years after the event also hit hard. Life throws you curve balls but today I am Grandfather to Four , Three girls and finally a Boy …. Most of my many Ex’s have maintained a friendship on meeting ….

My last ex, we were together for a year and a half. Which is the longest I’ve ever been with someone, We had a big fight for some little BS and other problems as well but whatever. It was never a loss. We didn’t had much moments, we were high school kids. I, like other guys, we move on with our love lives.

When I have broken up with an ex, I never felt as if it was my loss. I left them for a reason; if anything, it was refreshing. If an ex broke up with me, I definitely felt like I lost something special, but with time it always ends up being for the best. As of right now, I don’t believe ending any of my past relationships was a loss.

surprisingly no no no :D Because they were never worth it. they were the wrong people. It had to be finished and done. But if you say whichever you have the most difficulty with, my answer would be my ex bf who has narcissistic personality disorder. I learned a lot from all of them, one or two of them were very bad people. I've met bad people so that I can distinguish my future people well

No, any of my exes I went into no contact with for my own good. But I will say sometimes I miss them and the ease with which we communicated and felt each other. But life goes on.🐺🐺🐺 You can't go back only forward.
